title: 111_s1403
content: The Act may be cited as the "Strengthen Social Work Training Act of 2009". It pertains to social work students. The "Strengthen Social Work Training Act of 2009" amends various sections of the Public Health Service Act to include graduate programs in clinical social work or social work in health professions schools, scholarships for clinical psychology and social work programs, and loan repayments and fellowships for faculty positions in social work. The "Strengthen Social Work Training Act of 2009" includes amendments to the Public Health Service Act to incorporate graduate programs in clinical social work and social work in health professions schools. It also provides scholarships for clinical psychology and social work programs, as well as loan repayments and fellowships for faculty positions in social work. Additionally, it amends paragraph (3) by including graduate programs in clinical psychology and social work after programs in behavioral and mental health. SEC. 3. GERIATRICS TRAINING PROJECTS. Section 753(b) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include social work degrees in teaching hospitals, mental health professionals, and geriatric social work. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include social work degrees in teaching hospitals, mental health professionals, and geriatric social work. Additionally, the amendment includes the insertion of social workers in behavioral and mental health professions, as well as departments of social work in departments of behavioral or mental health. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include a Social Work Training Program under section 770, focusing on social work degrees in teaching hospitals, mental health professionals, and geriatric social work. This program also integrates social workers into behavioral and mental health professions. The Secretary may provide grants or contracts to hospitals, schools of social work, or nonprofit entities to establish social work training programs and offer financial assistance to individuals specializing in social work. The Secretary may award grants to schools offering social work programs to establish academic units for clinical instruction in social work. Grants may also be provided for financial assistance to individuals planning to teach in social work training programs. The Secretary may award grants to schools for establishing academic units in social work or expanding existing programs. The duration of payments from the grant cannot exceed 5 years and is subject to annual approval and funding availability. The Secretary may allocate $10,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2010-2012 for grants and contracts under subsection (b) of this section. Additionally, section 770A is amended, excluding section 770 from the subpart's activities. SEC. 5. Clinical social worker services are amended in the Public Health Service Act to include clinical social workers alongside psychologists in various paragraphs.
